summary: The Protect Elections from Deceptive AI Act aims to prevent the distribution of AI-generated audio or visual media that is deceptive and related to candidates for Federal office before an election. The bill defines "deceptive AI-generated audio or visual media" and prohibits its distribution in Federal election activities. Exemptions are provided for bona fide news broadcasts, publications, satire, and parody. It allows covered individuals to seek injunctive relief and damages in civil actions. The plaintiff must prove the violation with clear and convincing evidence. The Act amends the Federal Election Campaign Act of 1971.
